definition: of the elder of two boys with the same family name, the principal field of study of a student at a university, have as one's principal field of study
details:
adjective
- of the elder of two boys with the same family name
- greater in number or size or amount
= example: greater in number or size or amount
- greater in scope or effect
= example: greater in scope or effect
- of full legal age
- of a scale or mode
= example: of a scale or mode
= synonyms: minor
- of the field of academic study in which one concentrates or specializes
= example: of the field of academic study in which one concentrates or specializes
- of greater importance or stature or rank
= example: of greater importance or stature or rank
- of greater seriousness or danger
= example: of greater seriousness or danger
noun
- the principal field of study of a student at a university
= example: the principal field of study of a student at a university
- a commissioned military officer in the United States Army or Air Force or Marines
- a university student who is studying a particular field as the principal subject
= example: a university student who is studying a particular field as the principal subject
verb
- have as one's principal field of study
= example: have as one's principal field of study
